results.title: Killing us softly: advertising's image of women
results.creator_credit: Jean Kilbourne, Joseph Vitagliano, Patricia Stallone and Cambridge Documentary Films
results.brief_description: Using hundreds of examples from magazines, newspapers, album covers and store-front windows, this film exposes the psychological and sexual schemes that underlie many advertising campaigns. With an intriguing mixture of statistics, humour, insight and outrage, Jean Kilbourne shows her audience that although individual advertisements may seem harmless by themselves, they add up to a powerful form of cultural conditioning.

results.title: Killing Priscilla
results.creator_credit: Lizzy Gardiner, Jane Scott, A Great Scott and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Not so very long ago, Stephan Elliott wrote and directed a movie called ‘The Adventures of Priscilla Queen of the Desert’ - a low-budget film that proved to be a worldwide smash grossing over a hundred million dollars at the box office. Four years and one flop (‘Welcome to Woop Woop’) later, Elliott is making ‘Eye of the beholder’ a film with a twelve million dollar budget, and an impressive cast which includes Ewan McGregor, k.d. lang, Ashley Judd and Jason Priestley. The storyline promises action-adventure in nine American cities across four different seasons. The financing has been done outside the studio system - through a team of sales agents who want a profit - or else, adding undue pressure to the project. Enter Lizzy Gardiner. Academy Award-winning costume designer and friend of Elliott’s for more than twenty years. In addition to bringing her expertise as a costume designer, Gardina also brings a Sony 1000 DVC camera, and in a moment of insanity Elliott gives her permission to document the whole process. What transpires is a no-holds-barred account of the reality of commercial filmmaking in the late 1990s: a study in passion, power, madness and lies.

results.title: Killing farm rats
results.brief_description: Portrays methods of killing rats on a large farm in Scotland. Chemical methods of control, such as gassing and pre-baiting are priveleged, but information on the long term deterence of rats is also provided.

results.title: Killer on the move
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the danger of hydatid (sheep tapeworm) infestation, common in Tasmania. Discusses the problem, particularly as it affects children, and shows briefly surgical treatment for the removal of a hydatid cyst.
results.description: Demonstrates the danger of hydatid (sheep tapeworm) infestation, common in Tasmania. Discusses the problem, particularly as it affects children, and shows briefly surgical treatment for the removal of a hydatid cyst.

results.title: Killer at large
results.creator_credit: Frank Jacoby, Alistair Cooke and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: A genial and unsuspecting businessman brings smallpox from Asia to Europe and triggers an international manhunt in which the health authorities of many countries cooperate with the Epidemic Warning Service of the World Health Organisation.

results.title: Kill Bill Vol. 1
results.creator_credit: Quentin Tarantino, Lawrence Bender, A Band Apart and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Quentin Tarantino, “Kill Bill Vol. 1” is a tribute to the many hours of martial arts films he must have seen as a fan over his lifetime. Classic elements of cinematographic style and action sequences are included in all their violent glory. The plot centres on a Bride’s (Uma Thurman) quest to exact revenge on those who prevented her from leaving the brutal world of the hired killer. Heavily pregnant and attending her wedding, all present at the church are massacred and she is shot in the head, leaving her in coma for four years. On recovering from the coma, the woman (Thurman) arms herself with a rare sword and goes about killing those who aimed to destroy her. We learn of the history of one of her most challenging opponents through the use of a detailed anime sequence - “The Origin of O-Ren” (Lucy Liu). Many are dead at the end of this film and the woman is only some way to crossing off the five people on her “Death List” - see also “Kill Bill Vol. 2”. Infused with the music, wit and humour of a Tarantino picture, “Kill Bill Vol. 1” is a classic revenge story with all of the requisite action sequences and fine storytelling. Cast includes Vivica A. Fox, Sonny Chiba, Chiaki Kuriyama, Gordon Liu, Michael Parks, Julia Dreyfus, Michael Bowen, Jun Kunimura, Kenji Oba, Yuki Kazamatsuri, James Parks, Daryl Hannah and Michael Madsen. SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB. PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS FILM (ALSO CONTAINING ANIMATION) HAS AN ‘R’ RATING FOR PERSONS OVER THE AGE OF 18 DUE TO THE EXPLICIT VIOLENT NATURE OF ITS CONTENT

constellations_other.name: What's in a name?
constellations_other.description: Pakeezah (1972) star Meena Kumari was not just 'the tragedy queen' of Hindi film – she also wrote poetry under the pseudonym Naaz. From famous families and stage names to gendered disguises, this Constellation explores how women have adopted different names and identities to facilitate their ambition.

results.title: Kill as we go
results.creator_credit: George E. Hughes, Ace Films and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Motor vehicles are a necessary part of Australian life - but they can kill. All road users should be educated to help reduce the road toll. Sponsored by the Australian Road Safety Council.

results.title: Kiko the kangaroo: red hot rhythm
results.brief_description: Animated film presenting Kiko the kangaroo. The orchestra in a broadcasting studio is playing red hot rhythm music. However the music is so hot that it actually sets the building alight. Kiko and his firemen come to the rescue to put out the fire.

results.title: Kiko the kangaroo: Kiko at the bat = Play ball
results.creator_credit: Mannie Davis, Paul Terry and Terry Toons
results.brief_description: It’s the day of the much anticipated ball-game between Kiko’s Australian Champs and the Jungle Giants. The battle begins and the advantage shifts from team to team until fortune smiles upon the Champs and honesty is rewarded with victory.

results.title: Kiko the kangaroo: hail the king
results.creator_credit: George Gordon, Mannie Davis, Paul Terry, Castle Films and Terrytoons
results.brief_description: Kiko cooks a chicken for the king who has just been coronated but unfortunately the king disapproves and Kiko is sent off to the tower as punishment. Or is this all just a dream! No dialogue - music soundtrack only.
